messages.subject: Re: Mindful Parenting?
messages.msgSnippet: No, those files are supposed to be public. Thank you for helping me out with this. I m going to see what went wrong. Here s the links I was trying to share
messages.messageBody:
No, those files are supposed to be public. Thank you for helping me
out with this. I'm going to see what went wrong.

Here's the links I was trying to share with you. I hope you like
some of them:

http://www.naomialdort.com/articles.html
http://sandradodd.com/peacefulparenting
http://themindfulparent.org/
http://www.naturalchild.org/

~ Joanne ~
Mom to Jacqueline (7), Shawna (10) & Cimion (13)
Adopted into our hearts October 30, 2003
http://anunschoolinglife.blogspot.com/
http://foreverparents.com

messages.msgSnippet: I m sorry it didn t work. It s a site I use to store my links and that particular folder is public. When you click on it it should take you to a lists of
messages.messageBody:
I'm sorry it didn't work. It's a site I use to store my links and that
particular folder is public. When you click on it it should take you to
a lists of sites. If you don't mind, can you try again and let me know
if it still doesn't work for you?

Thanks!
~ Joanne ~
Mom to Jacqueline (7), Shawna (10) & Cimion (13)
Adopted into our hearts October 30, 2003
http://anunschoolinglife.blogspot.com/

--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Tina" <zoocrew@...> wrote:
>
> This area is always a challenge for me. The three kids we still have
> at home and unschool with are 12, 14 and 16. I've always known there
> was a better way to be a parent than the normal crap that you hear of
> in mainstream society. We've come a very long way over the years.
> Despite this I have always struggled in the creative aspect parenting
> and relationships for that matter. Can anyone recommend books,
> websites, or other resources that will help get my gears turning?
>
> Thanks - Tina
>

messages.subject: Mindful Parenting?
messages.msgSnippet: This area is always a challenge for me.  The three kids we still have at home and unschool with are 12, 14 and 16.  I ve always known there was a better way to
messages.messageBody:
This area is always a challenge for me. The three kids we still have
at home and unschool with are 12, 14 and 16. I've always known there
was a better way to be a parent than the normal crap that you hear of
in mainstream society. We've come a very long way over the years.
Despite this I have always struggled in the creative aspect parenting
and relationships for that matter. Can anyone recommend books,
websites, or other resources that will help get my gears turning?

Thanks - Tina
